context: Tests whether the agent produces a presentation outline following the skill's specific markdown format, placeholder conventions, callback markers for recurring elements, meme brief structure, and modular design markers.

checklist.name: Section time annotations
checklist.description: Outline sections use the format '## Section Name [N min, slides X-Y]' with both time allocation and slide range

checklist.name: Typed placeholders
checklist.description: Outline contains at least 2 different placeholder types from the set: [AUTHOR NN], [DEMO NN], [DATA NN], [SCREENSHOT NN], [MEME NN]

checklist.name: Independent numbering
checklist.description: Each placeholder type uses its own numbering sequence (e.g., [MEME 01], [MEME 02] separately from [DATA 01], [DATA 02]) â€” not a single global counter

checklist.name: Meme brief structure
checklist.description: At least one meme placeholder includes a structured brief with all four fields: template/image name, search query for sourcing, overlay text to apply, and what argument the meme serves

checklist.name: Recurring element tracking
checklist.description: The outline explicitly marks where the recurring 'security theater' metaphor or 'checklist' visual reappears later in the talk, using bracketed annotations that reference the earlier slide number or element

checklist.name: Cut line present
checklist.description: Outline contains a [CUT LINE] marker indicating where content can be dropped for a shorter version

checklist.name: Opening sequence
checklist.description: The first 5 slides include a title slide, an opening hook, a brief bio, and a shownotes URL slide (in approximately that order)

checklist.name: Three-part closing
checklist.description: The closing sequence includes all three elements: a numbered summary (with exactly 3 points), a call-to-action, and social/shownotes handles

checklist.name: Slide budget compliance
checklist.description: Total slide count stays at or below 70 (the budget for a 45-minute slot from the profile)

checklist.name: Speaker notes present
checklist.description: At least 5 slides include speaker notes written in conversational voice (not just visual descriptions)

checklist.name: Verbal signatures used
checklist.description: Speaker notes include at least 2 of the verbal signatures from the vault: 'is not a thing', 'right?', 'raise your hand if', 'full stop', 'okay so'

checklist.name: Slide budget header
checklist.description: The outline header includes a slide budget line showing the total allowed slides for the duration
